text: Abdizhamil Karimuly Nurpeisov (; 22 October 1924 â€“ 5 February 2022) was a Kazakh writer and translator. Between 1962 to 1964 he worked as a head editor of the magazine Zhuldyz. He was a delegate of the Supreme Soviet of the Kazakh SSR. He was also President of the Kazakh PEN Club. He was known for his The Blood and Sweat trilogy. Nurpeisov died on 5 February 2022, at the age of 97. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Kazakhstani writers Category:Asian novelists
title: Abdizhamil Karimuly Nurpeisov
